meanings.definition: The process of cutting extremely thin slices of material for examination under a microscope.
meanings.sent1: In ultramicrotomy, materials are sliced very thinly for microscope study.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use ultramicrotomy to prepare samples for detailed microscope analysis.
meanings.sent3: During the ultramicrotomy process, the slices became so thin, they almost disappeared!
meanings.sent4: Her precision in ultramicrotomy was like a skilled chef slicing paper-thin vegetables.
meanings.sent5: The art of ultramicrotomy requires steady hands and keen eyesight.

meanings.definition: The act of using a device called an ultramicrotome to slice samples into ultrathin sections.
meanings.sent1: With the ultramicrotome, ultramicrotomy becomes a precise task of slicing samples thinly.
meanings.sent2: The ultramicrotome is an essential tool for ultramicrotomy in laboratories.
meanings.sent3: The ultramicrotome decided to take a break from all the slicing during ultramicrotomy.
meanings.sent4: The ultramicrotome hummed softly as it performed its ultramicrotomy duties.
meanings.sent5: The ultramicrotome's blade glided smoothly, showcasing the art of ultramicrotomy.

meanings.definition: The technique of preparing specimens for electron microscopy by cutting them into thin sections.
meanings.sent1: Electron microscopy relies on ultramicrotomy to prepare specimens for detailed examination.
meanings.sent2: The technician mastered the technique of ultramicrotomy for electron microscopy samples.
meanings.sent3: The specimens whispered to each other, 'Here comes ultramicrotomy, brace yourselves!'
meanings.sent4: Ultramicrotomy transformed the specimens into delicate works of art for electron microscopy.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of ultramicrotomy lies in its ability to reveal hidden details under the electron microscope.
